events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle and filed the initial claim with basic accident details and photos.
After reviewing the claim, it was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords like vehicle collision and car damages noted in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle all further communications and assist the customer throughout the claim process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment to the claimant confirming receipt of the claim and assuring timely processing.
The claim handler requested additional documents including the police report, vehicle registration, and repair estimates to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including photos of the accident scene and the official police accident report.
The investigator began examining the submitted evidence to determine fault and assess the extent of vehicle damage for claim approval.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault, and damage estimates were verified against repair shop bills and photos.
A settlement amount covering the full repair costs was proposed to the customer, including compensation for the rental car used during repairs.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved by the underwriting team after verifying all documents and investigation findings.
The agreed settlement payment was issued promptly to the customerâ€™s account, covering all repair expenses and rental reimbursement.
The claim file was formally closed following successful payment and customer confirmation that vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All claim records and correspondence were archived for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
